Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கருமம் சிதையாமல் கண்ணோட வல்லார்க்கு உரிமை உடைத்திவ் வுலகு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The world is theirs (kings) who are able to show kindness, without injury to their affairs, (administration of justice).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise ruler is depicted balancing two symbolic objects. In one hand, they hold a flawlessly operating set of intricate gears, representing Duty ('கருமம்'). In the other, they hold a gentle, glowing dove, representing Benignity ('கண்ணோட்டம்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Because the ruler maintains this perfect balance—showing kindness without letting duty fail—the world, visualized as a glowing, celestial globe ('இவ்வுலகு'), is shown willingly offering itself to them, acknowledging their rightful ownership.
Layered_Composition.Background: A prosperous and orderly kingdom that functions perfectly, a testament to the ruler's balanced approach.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The world belongs to those who can exercise benignity without compromising their essential duties.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The gears of duty and the dove of kindness are the two balanced elements. The world offering itself as a possession ('உரிமை உடைத்து') is the result of this mastery.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A clear, bright light of wisdom illuminates the scene. The gears and the dove have their own distinct but harmonious glows. The globe of the world shines with a willing, golden light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A centered, medium shot that emphasizes the act of balancing the two symbolic objects.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a clean, majestic aesthetic and detailed symbolic objects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Balanced, high-key lighting to symbolize clarity and order.

Cultural_Anchors: Benignity without harming Duty ('கருமம் சிதையாமல் கண்ணோட')
Ownership of the World ('உரிமை உடைத்து இவ்வுலகு')
The balance of compassion and responsibility.
